enable_detailed_recording.description:
Set this value to `true` to have Tyk store the inbound request and outbound response data in HTTP Wire format as part of the Analytics data.
Please note, this will greatly increase your analytics DB size and can cause performance degradation on analytics processing by the Dashboard.
This setting can be overridden with an organization flag, enabed at an API level, or on individual Key level.

enable_geo_ip.description: Tyk can store GeoIP information based on MaxMind DB’s to enable GeoIP tracking on inbound request analytics. Set this value to `true` and assign a DB using the `geo_ip_db_path` setting.

enable_multiple_analytics_keys.description:
Set this to `true` to have Tyk automatically divide the analytics records in multiple analytics keys.
This is especially useful when `storage.enable_cluster` is set to `true` since it will distribute the analytic keys across all the cluster nodes.

geo_ip_db_path.description:
Path to a MaxMind GeoIP database
The analytics GeoIP DB can be replaced on disk. It will cleanly auto-reload every hour.

ignored_ips.description:
Adding IP addresses to this list will cause Tyk to ignore these IPs in the analytics data. These IP addresses will not produce an analytics log record.
This is useful for health checks and other samplers that might skew usage data.
The IP addresses must be provided as a JSON array, with the values being single IPs. CIDR values are not supported.

normalise_urls.description: This section describes methods that enable you to normalise inbound URLs in your analytics to have more meaningful per-path data.

pool_size.description: Number of workers used to process analytics. Defaults to number of CPU cores.

purge_interval.description: You can set the interval length on how often the tyk Gateway will purge analytics data. This value is in seconds and defaults to 10 seconds.

records_buffer_size.description: Number of records in analytics queue, per worker. Default: 1000.

serializer_type.description: Determines the serialization engine for analytics. Available options: msgpack, and protobuf. By default, msgpack.

storage_expiration_time.description:
You can set a time (in seconds) to configure how long analytics are kept if they are not processed. The default is 60 seconds.
This is used to prevent the potential infinite growth of Redis analytics storage.

type.description: Set empty for a Self-Managed installation or `rpc` for multi-cloud.

control_api.description: Certificates used for Control API Mutual TLS

dashboard_api.description: Used for communicating with the Dashboard if it is configured to use Mutual TLS

mdcb_api.description: Certificates used for MDCB Mutual TLS

upstream.description:
Upstream is used to specify the certificates to be used in mutual TLS connections to upstream services. These are set at gateway level as a map of domain -> certificate id or path.
For example if you want Tyk to use the certificate `ab23ef123` for requests to the `example.com` upstream and `/certs/default.pem` for all other upstreams then:
In `tyk.conf` you would configure `"security": {"certificates": {"upstream": {"*": "/certs/default.pem", "example.com": "ab23ef123"}}}`
And if using environment variables you would set this to `*:/certs/default.pem,example.com:ab23ef123`.

grpc_recv_max_size.description: Maximum message which can be received from a gRPC server

grpc_send_max_size.description: Maximum message which can be sent to gRPC server

python_path_prefix.description: Sets the path to built-in Tyk modules. This will be part of the Python module lookup path. The value used here is the default one for most installations.

python_version.description: If you have multiple Python versions installed you can specify your version.

allow_insecure_configs.description: Can be set to disable Dashboard message signature verification. When set to `true`, `public_key_path` can be ignored.

allow_master_keys.description:
If AllowMasterKeys is set to true, session objects (key definitions) that do not have explicit access rights set
will be allowed by Tyk. This means that keys that are created have access to ALL APIs, which in many cases is
unwanted behavior unless you are sure about what you are doing.

allow_remote_config.description: Allow your Dashboard to remotely set Gateway configuration via the Nodes screen.

analytics_config.description: This section defines options on what analytics data to store.

app_path.description:
If Tyk is being used in its standard configuration (Open Source installations), then API definitions are stored in the apps folder (by default in /opt/tyk-gateway/apps).
This location is scanned for .json files and re-scanned at startup or reload.
See the API section of the Tyk Gateway API for more details.

auth_override.description: This is used as part of the RPC / Hybrid back-end configuration in a Tyk Enterprise installation and isn’t used anywhere else.

basic_auth_hash_key_function.description:
Specify the Key hashing algorithm for "basic auth". Possible values: murmur64, murmur128, sha256, bcrypt.
Will default to "bcrypt" if not set.

bundle_base_url.description: Is a base URL that will be used to download the bundle. In this example we have `bundle-latest.zip` specified in the API settings, Tyk will fetch the following URL: http://my-bundle-server.com/bundles/bundle-latest.zip (see the next section for details).

bundle_insecure_skip_verify.description: Disable TLS validation for bundle URLs

close_connections.description: If set, disable keepalive between User and Tyk

cloud.description: Cloud flag shows the Gateway runs in Tyk-cloud.

control_api_hostname.description: Custom hostname for the Control API

control_api_port.description: Set to run your Gateway Control API on a separate port, and protect it behind a firewall if needed. Please make sure you follow this guide when setting the control port https://tyk.io/docs/planning-for-production/#change-your-control-port.

coprocess_options.description: Configuration options for Python and gRPC plugins.

db_app_conf_options.description: This section defines API loading and shard options. Enable these settings to selectively load API definitions on a node from your Dashboard service.

disable_dashboard_zeroconf.description:
Disable the capability of the Gateway to `autodiscover` the Dashboard through heartbeat messages via Redis.
The goal of zeroconf is auto-discovery, so you do not have to specify the Tyk Dashboard address in your Gateway`tyk.conf` file.
In some specific cases, for example, when the Dashboard is bound to a public domain, not accessible inside an internal network, or similar, `disable_dashboard_zeroconf` can be set to `true`, in favor of directly specifying a Tyk Dashboard address.

disable_key_actions_by_username.description:
DisableKeyActionsByUsername disables key search by username.
When this is set to `true` you are able to search for keys only by keyID or key hash (if `hash_keys` is also set to `true`)
Note that if `hash_keys` is also set to `true` then the keyID will not be provided for APIs secured using basic auth. In this scenario the only search option would be to use key hash
If you are using the Tyk Dashboard, you must configure this setting with the same value in both Gateway and Dashboard

disable_ports_whitelist.description: Disable port whilisting, essentially allowing you to use any port for your API.

disable_regexp_cache.description: If set to `true` this allows you to disable the regular expression cache. The default setting is `false`.

disable_virtual_path_blobs.description:
Disable virtual endpoints and the code will not be loaded into the VM when the API definition initialises.
This is useful for systems where you want to avoid having third-party code run.

dns_cache.description:
This section enables the global configuration of the expireable DNS records caching for your Gateway API endpoints.
By design caching affects only http(s), ws(s) protocols APIs and doesn’t affect any plugin/middleware DNS queries.

```
"dns_cache": {
  "enabled": true, //Turned off by default
  "ttl": 60, //Time in seconds before the record will be removed from cache
  "multiple_ips_handle_strategy": "random" //A strategy, which will be used when dns query will reply with more than 1 ip address per single host.
}
```

enable_analytics.description:
Tyk is capable of recording every hit to your API to a database with various filtering parameters. Set this value to `true` and fill in the sub-section below to enable logging.

Note:
  For performance reasons, Tyk will store traffic data to Redis initially and then purge the data from Redis to MongoDB or other data stores on a regular basis as determined by the purge_delay setting in your Tyk Pump configuration.

enable_bundle_downloader.description:
Enable downloading Plugin bundles
Example:
```
"enable_bundle_downloader": true,
"bundle_base_url": "http://my-bundle-server.com/bundles/",
"public_key_path": "/path/to/my/pubkey",
```

enable_custom_domains.description: Allows you to use custom domains

enable_hashed_keys_listing.description: Allows the listing of hashed API keys

enable_http_profiler.description: Enable debugging of your Tyk Gateway by exposing profiling information through https://tyk.io/docs/troubleshooting/tyk-gateway/profiling/

enable_jsvm.description: Set to true if you are using JSVM custom middleware or virtual endpoints.

enable_key_logging.description: By default all key IDs in logs are hidden. Set to `true` if you want to see them for debugging reasons.

enable_separate_analytics_store.description: Enable separate analytics storage. Used together with `analytics_storage`.

enable_separate_cache_store.description: Enable to use a separate Redis for cache storage

enforce_org_data_age.description: Allows you to dynamically configure analytics expiration on a per organization level

enforce_org_data_detail_logging.description: Allows you to dynamically configure detailed logging on a per organization level

enforce_org_quotas.description: Allows you to dynamically configure organization quotas on a per organization level

force_global_session_lifetime.description: Enable global API token expiration. Can be needed if all your APIs using JWT or oAuth 2.0 auth methods with dynamically generated keys.

hash_key_function.description: Specify the Key hashing algorithm. Possible values: murmur64, murmur128, sha256.

hash_key_function_fallback.description: Specify your previous key hashing algorithm if you migrated from one algorithm to another.

health_check.description: This section enables the configuration of the health-check API endpoint and the size of the sample data cache (in seconds).

health_check_endpoint_name.description: Enables you to rename the /hello endpoint

hide_generator_header.description: HideGeneratorHeader will mask the 'X-Generator' and 'X-Mascot-...' headers, if set to true.

hostname.description: Force your Gateway to work only on a specific domain name. Can be overridden by API custom domain.

ignore_canonical_mime_header_key.description:
When enabled Tyk ignores the canonical format of the MIME header keys.

For example when a request header with a “my-header” key is injected using “global_headers”, the upstream would typically get it as “My-Header”. When this flag is enabled it will be sent as “my-header” instead.

Current support is limited to JavaScript plugins, global header injection, virtual endpoint and JQ transform header rewrites.
This functionality doesn’t affect headers that are sent by the HTTP client and the default formatting will apply in this case.

For technical details refer to the [CanonicalMIMEHeaderKey](https://golang.org/pkg/net/textproto/#CanonicalMIMEHeaderKey) functionality in the Go documentation.

ignore_endpoint_case.description: Ignore the case of any endpoints for APIs managed by Tyk. Setting this to `true` will override any individual API and Ignore, Blacklist and Whitelist plugin endpoint settings.

jsvm_timeout.description: Set the execution timeout for JSVM plugins and virtal endpoints

jwt_ssl_insecure_skip_verify.description: Skip TLS verification for JWT JWKs url validation

kv.description:
This section enables the use of the KV capabilities to substitute configuration values.
See more details https://tyk.io/docs/tyk-configuration-reference/kv-store/

listen_address.description: If your machine has multiple network devices or IPs you can force the Gateway to use the IP address you want.

listen_port.description: Setting this value will change the port that Tyk listens on. Default: 8080.

local_session_cache.description:
Tyk can cache some data locally, this can speed up lookup times on a single node and lower the number of connections and operations being done on Redis. It will however introduce a slight delay when updating or modifying keys as the cache must expire.
This does not affect rate limiting.

log_format.description:
You can now configure the log format to be either the standard or json format
If not set or left empty, it will default to `standard`.

log_level.description:
You can now set a logging level (log_level). The following levels can be set: debug, info, warn, error.
If not set or left empty, it will default to `info`.

logstash_transport.description: Logstash network transport. Values: tcp or udp.

management_node.description:
If set to `true`, distributed rate limiter will be disabled for this node, and it will be excluded from any rate limit calculation.

Note:
  If you set `db_app_conf_options.node_is_segmented` to `true` for multiple Gateway nodes, you should ensure that `management_node` is set to `false`.
  This is to ensure visibility for the management node across all APIs.

max_conn_time.description: Maximum connection time. If set it will force gateway reconnect to the upstream.

max_idle_connections.description: Maximum idle connections, per API, between Tyk and Upstream. By default not limited.

max_idle_connections_per_host.description: Maximum idle connections, per API, per upstream, between Tyk and Upstream. Default:100

middleware_path.description: Path to the plugins dirrectory. By default is ``./middleware`.

monitor.description:
The monitor section is useful if you wish to enforce a global trigger limit on organization and user quotas.
This feature will trigger a webhook event to fire when specific triggers are reached.
Triggers can be global (set in the node), by organization (set in the organization session object) or by key (set in the key session object)

While Organization-level and Key-level triggers can be tiered (e.g. trigger at 10%, trigger at 20%, trigger at 80%), in the node-level configuration only a global value can be set.
If a global value and specific trigger level are the same the trigger will only fire once:

```
"monitor": {
  "enable_trigger_monitors": true,
  "configuration": {
   "method": "POST",
   "target_path": "http://domain.com/notify/quota-trigger",
   "template_path": "templates/monitor_template.json",
   "header_map": {
     "some-secret": "89787855"
   },
   "event_timeout": 10
 },
 "global_trigger_limit": 80.0,
 "monitor_user_keys": false,
 "monitor_org_keys": true
},
```

node_secret.description: The shared secret between the Gateway and the Dashboard to ensure that API Definition downloads, heartbeat and Policy loads are from a valid source.

oas_config.description: OAS holds the configuration for various OpenAPI-specific functionalities

oauth_error_status_code.description: Configures the OAuth error status code returned. If not set, it defaults to a 403 error.

oauth_redirect_uri_separator.description: Character which should be used as a separator for OAuth redirect URI URLs. Default: ;.

oauth_refresh_token_expire.description: Change the expiry time of a refresh token. By default 14 days (in seconds).

oauth_token_expire.description: Change the expiry time of OAuth tokens (in seconds).

oauth_token_expired_retain_period.description: Specifies how long expired tokens are stored in Redis. The value is in seconds and the default is 0. Using the default means expired tokens are never removed from Redis.

override_messages.description:
Override the default error code and or message returned by middleware.
The following message IDs can be used to override the message and error codes:

AuthToken message IDs
* `auth.auth_field_missing`
* `auth.key_not_found`

OIDC message IDs
* `oauth.auth_field_missing`
* `oauth.auth_field_malformed`
* `oauth.key_not_found`
* `oauth.client_deleted`

Sample Override Message Setting
```
"override_messages": {
  "oauth.auth_field_missing" : {
   "code": 401,
   "message": "Token is not authorized"
 }
}
```

pid_file_location.description: Linux PID file location. Do not change unless you know what you are doing. Default: /var/run/tyk/tyk-gateway.pid

policies.description:
The policies section allows you to define where Tyk can find its policy templates. Policy templates are similar to key definitions in that they allow you to set quotas, access rights and rate limits for keys.
Policies are loaded when Tyk starts and if changed require a hot-reload so they are loaded into memory.
A policy can be defined in a file (Open Source installations) or from the same database as the Dashboard.

ports_whitelist.description:
Defines the ports that will be available for the API services to bind to in the format
documented here https://tyk.io/docs/key-concepts/tcp-proxy/#allowing-specific-ports.
Ports can be configured per protocol, e.g. https, tls etc.
If configuring via environment variable `TYK_GW_PORTWHITELIST` then remember to escape
JSON strings.

proxy_close_connections.description:
Disable keepalives between Tyk and your upstream service.
Set this value to `true` to force Tyk to close the connection with the server, otherwise the connections will remain open for as long as your OS keeps TCP connections open.
This can cause a file-handler limit to be exceeded. Setting to false can have performance benefits as the connection can be reused.

proxy_default_timeout.description:
This can specify a default timeout in seconds for upstream API requests.
Default: 30 seconds

proxy_enable_http2.description: Enable HTTP2 support between Tyk and your upstream service. Required for gRPC.

proxy_ssl_ciphers.description: Allow list of ciphers for connection between Tyk and your upstream service.

proxy_ssl_insecure_skip_verify.description: Globally ignore TLS verification between Tyk and your Upstream services

proxy_ssl_max_version.description: Maximum TLS version for connection between Tyk and your upstream service.

proxy_ssl_min_version.description: Minimum TLS version for connection between Tyk and your upstream service.

public_key_path.description: While communicating with the Dashboard. By default, all messages are signed by a private/public key pair. Set path to public key.

regexp_cache_expire.description:
If you set `disable_regexp_cache` to `false`, you can use this setting to limit how long the regular expression cache is kept for in seconds.
The default is 60 seconds. This must be a positive value. If you set to 0 this uses the default value.

reload_interval.description:
ReloadInterval defines a duration in seconds within which the gateway responds to a reload event.
The value defaults to 1, values lower than 1 are ignored.

resource_sync.description: ResourceSync configures mitigation strategy in case sync fails.

secret.description:
This should be changed as soon as Tyk is installed on your system.
This value is used in every interaction with the Tyk Gateway API. It should be passed along as the X-Tyk-Authorization header in any requests made.
Tyk assumes that you are sensible enough not to expose the management endpoints publicly and to keep this configuration value to yourself.

secrets.description: Secrets are key-value pairs that can be accessed in the dashboard via "secrets://"

session_lifetime_respects_key_expiration.description: SessionLifetimeRespectsKeyExpiration respects the key expiration time when the session lifetime is less than the key expiration. That is, Redis waits the key expiration for physical removal.

slave_options.description:
The `slave_options` allow you to configure the RPC slave connection required for MDCB installations.
These settings must be configured for every RPC slave/worker node.

ssl_force_common_name_check.description: Force the validation of the hostname against the common name, even if TLS verification is disabled.

statsd_connection_string.description: Address of StatsD server. If set enable statsd monitoring.

storage.description: This section defines your Redis configuration.

suppress_redis_signal_reload.description: Disable dynamic API and Policy reloads, e.g. it will load new changes only on procecss start.

syslog_transport.description: Syslong transport to use. Values: tcp or udp.

template_path.description: Path to error and webhook templates. Defaults to the current binary path.

tracing.description:
Section for configuring OpenTracing support
Deprecated: use OpenTelemetry instead.

track_404_logs.description: Show 404 HTTP errors in your Gateway application logs

tyk_js_path.description: Path to the JavaScript file which will be pre-loaded for any JSVM middleware or virtual endpoint. Useful for defining global shared functions.

uptime_tests.description:
Tyk nodes can provide uptime awareness, uptime testing and analytics for your underlying APIs uptime and availability.
Tyk can also notify you when a service goes down.

use_db_app_configs.description:
If you are a Tyk Pro user, this option will enable polling the Dashboard service for API definitions.
On startup Tyk will attempt to connect and download any relevant application configurations from from your Dashboard instance.
The files are exactly the same as the JSON files on disk with the exception of a BSON ID supplied by the Dashboard service.

use_redis_log.description: Enables the real-time Gateway log view in the Dashboard.

version_header.description: Expose version header with a given name. Works only for versioned APIs.

connection_string.description: Set the URL to your Dashboard instance (or a load balanced instance). The URL needs to be formatted as: `http://dashboard_host:port`

connection_timeout.description: Set a timeout value, in seconds, for your Dashboard connection. Default value is 30.

node_is_segmented.description: Set to `true` to enable filtering (sharding) of APIs.

tags.description:
The tags to use when filtering (sharding) Tyk Gateway nodes. Tags are processed as `OR` operations.
If you include a non-filter tag (e.g. an identifier such as `node-id-1`, this will become available to your Dashboard analytics).

enabled.description: Setting this value to `true` will enable caching of DNS queries responses used for API endpoint’s host names. By default caching is disabled.

multiple_ips_handle_strategy.description:
A strategy which will be used when a DNS query will reply with more than 1 IP Address per single host.
As a DNS query response IP Addresses can have a changing order depending on DNS server balancing strategy (eg: round robin, geographically dependent origin-ip ordering, etc) this option allows you to not to limit the connection to the first host in a cached response list or prevent response caching.

* `pick_first` will instruct your Tyk Gateway to connect to the first IP in a returned IP list and cache the response.
* `random` will instruct your Tyk Gateway to connect to a random IP in a returned IP list and cache the response.
* `no_cache` will instruct your Tyk Gateway to connect to the first IP in a returned IP list and fetch each addresses list without caching on each API endpoint DNS query.

ttl.description:
This setting allows you to specify a duration in seconds before the record will be removed from cache after being added to it on the first DNS query resolution of API endpoints.
Setting `ttl` to `-1` prevents record from being expired and removed from cache on next check interval.

enable_health_checks.description: Setting this value to `true` will enable the health-check endpoint on /Tyk/health.

health_check_value_timeouts.description:
This setting defaults to 60 seconds. This is the time window that Tyk uses to sample health-check data.
You can set a higher value for more accurate data (a larger sample period), or a lower value for less accurate data.
The reason this value is configurable is because sample data takes up space in your Redis DB to store the data to calculate samples. On high-availability systems this may not be desirable and smaller values may be preferred.

certificates.description: Deprecated. SSL certificates used by Gateway server.

enable_path_prefix_matching.description:
EnablePathPrefixMatching changes how the gateway matches incoming URL paths against routes (patterns) defined in the API definition.
By default, the gateway uses wildcard matching. When EnablePathPrefixMatching is enabled, it switches to prefix matching. For example, a defined path such as `/json` will only match request URLs that begin with `/json`, rather than matching any URL containing `/json`.

The gateway checks the request URL against several variations depending on whether path versioning is enabled:
- Full path (listen path + version + endpoint): `/listen-path/v4/json`
- Non-versioned full path (listen path + endpoint): `/listen-path/json`
- Path without version (endpoint only): `/json`

For patterns that start with `/`, the gateway prepends `^` before performing the check, ensuring a true prefix match.
For patterns that start with `^`, the gateway will already perform prefix matching so EnablePathPrefixMatching will have no impact.
This option allows for more specific and controlled routing of API requests, potentially reducing unintended matches. Note that you may need to adjust existing route definitions when enabling this option.

Example:

With wildcard matching, `/json` might match `/api/v1/data/json`.
With prefix matching, `/json` would not match `/api/v1/data/json`, but would match `/json/data`.

Combining EnablePathPrefixMatching with EnablePathSuffixMatching will result in exact URL matching, with `/json` being evaluated as `^/json$`.

enable_path_suffix_matching.description:
EnablePathSuffixMatching changes how the gateway matches incoming URL paths against routes (patterns) defined in the API definition.
By default, the gateway uses wildcard matching. When EnablePathSuffixMatching is enabled, it switches to suffix matching. For example, a defined path such as `/json` will only match request URLs that end with `/json`, rather than matching any URL containing `/json`.

The gateway checks the request URL against several variations depending on whether path versioning is enabled:
- Full path (listen path + version + endpoint): `/listen-path/v4/json`
- Non-versioned full path (listen path + endpoint): `/listen-path/json`
- Path without version (endpoint only): `/json`

For patterns that already end with `$`, the gateway will already perform suffix matching so EnablePathSuffixMatching will have no impact. For all other patterns, the gateway appends `$` before performing the check, ensuring a true suffix match.
This option allows for more specific and controlled routing of API requests, potentially reducing unintended matches. Note that you may need to adjust existing route definitions when enabling this option.

Example:

With wildcard matching, `/json` might match `/api/v1/json/data`.
With suffix matching, `/json` would not match `/api/v1/json/data`, but would match `/api/v1/json`.

Combining EnablePathSuffixMatching with EnablePathPrefixMatching will result in exact URL matching, with `/json` being evaluated as `^/json$`.

enable_strict_routes.description:
EnableStrictRoutes changes the routing to avoid nearest-neighbour requests on overlapping routes

- if disabled, `/apple` will route to `/app`, the current default behavior,
- if enabled, `/app` only responds to `/app`, `/app/` and `/app/*` but not `/apple`

Regular expressions and parameterized routes will be left alone regardless of this setting.

enable_websockets.description: Enabled WebSockets and server side events support

flush_interval.description:
Set this to the number of seconds that Tyk uses to flush content from the proxied upstream connection to the open downstream connection.
This option needed be set for streaming protocols like Server Side Events, or gRPC streaming.

max_request_body_size.description:
MaxRequestBodySize configures a maximum size limit for request body size (in bytes) for all APIs on the Gateway.

Tyk Gateway will evaluate all API requests against this size limit and will respond with HTTP 413 status code if the body of the request is larger.

Two methods are used to perform the comparison:
 - If the API Request contains the `Content-Length` header, this is directly compared against `MaxRequestBodySize`.
 - If the `Content-Length` header is not provided, the Request body is read in chunks to compare total size against `MaxRequestBodySize`.

A value of zero (default) means that no maximum is set and API requests will not be tested.

See more information about setting request size limits here:
https://tyk.io/docs/basic-config-and-security/control-limit-traffic/request-size-limits/#maximum-request-sizes

read_timeout.description: API Consumer -> Gateway network read timeout. Not setting this config, or setting this to 0, defaults to 120 seconds

server_name.description: Start your Gateway HTTP server on specific server name

skip_client_ca_announcement.description:
When mTLS enabled, this option allows to skip client CA announcement in the TLS handshake.
This option is useful when you have a lot of ClientCAs and you want to reduce the handshake overhead, as some clients can hit TLS handshake limits.
This option does not give any hints to the client, on which certificate to pick (but this is very rare situation when it is required)

skip_target_path_escaping.description: Disable automatic character escaping, allowing to path original URL data to the upstream.

skip_url_cleaning.description:
Allow the use of a double slash in a URL path. This can be useful if you need to pass raw URLs to your API endpoints.
For example: `http://myapi.com/get/http://example.com`.

ssl_certificates.description: SSL certificates used by your Gateway server. A list of certificate IDs or path to files.

ssl_ciphers.description: Custom SSL ciphers. See list of ciphers here https://tyk.io/docs/basic-config-and-security/security/tls-and-ssl/#specify-tls-cipher-suites-for-tyk-gateway--tyk-dashboard

ssl_insecure_skip_verify.description: Disable TLS verification. Required if you are using self-signed certificates.

use_ssl.description: Set to true to enable SSL connections

write_timeout.description: API Consumer -> Gateway network write timeout. Not setting this config, or setting this to 0, defaults to 120 seconds

check_duration.description:
Frequencies of performing interval healthchecks for Redis, Dashboard, and RPC layer.
Expressed in Nanoseconds. For example: 1000000000 -> 1s.
Default: 10 seconds.

disable_cached_session_state.description: By default sessions are set to cache. Set this to `true` to stop Tyk from caching keys locally on the node.

enable_trigger_monitors.description: Set this to `true` to have monitors enabled in your configuration for the node.

global_trigger_limit.description: The trigger limit, as a percentage of the quota that must be reached in order to trigger the event, any time the quota percentage is increased the event will trigger.

monitor_org_keys.description: Apply the monitoring subsystem to organization keys.

monitor_user_keys.description: Apply the monitoring subsystem to user keys.

custom_patterns.description: This is a list of custom patterns you can add. These must be valid regex strings. Tyk will replace these values with a {var} placeholder.

enabled.description: Set this to `true` to enable normalisation.

normalise_numbers.description: Set this to true to have Tyk automatically match for numeric IDs, it will match with a preceding slash so as not to capture actual numbers:

normalise_ulids.description: Each ULID will be replaced with a placeholder {ulid}

normalise_uuids.description: Each UUID will be replaced with a placeholder {uuid}

validate_examples.description: ValidateExamples enables validation of values provided in `example` and `examples` fields against the declared schemas in the OpenAPI Document. Defaults to false.

validate_schema_defaults.description: ValidateSchemaDefaults enables validation of values provided in `default` fields against the declared schemas in the OpenAPI Document. Defaults to false.

allow_explicit_policy_id.description:
In a Pro installation, Tyk will load Policy IDs and use the internal object-ID as the ID of the policy.
This is not portable in cases where the data needs to be moved from installation to installation.

If you set this value to `true`, then the id parameter in a stored policy (or imported policy using the Dashboard API), will be used instead of the internal ID.

This option should only be used when moving an installation to a new database.

policy_connection_string.description:
This option is required if `policies.policy_source` is set to `service`.
Set this to the URL of your Tyk Dashboard installation. The URL needs to be formatted as: http://dashboard_host:port.

policy_path.description:
This option only applies in OSS deployment when the `policies.policy_source` is either set
to `file` or an empty string. If `policies.policy_path` is set, then Tyk will load policies
from all the JSON files under the directory specified by the `policies.policy_path` option.
In this configuration, Tyk Gateway will allow policy management through the Gateway API.

policy_record_name.description:
This option only applies in OSS deployment when the `policies.policy_source` is either set
to `file` or an empty string. If `policies.policy_path` is not set, then Tyk will load policies
from the JSON file specified by `policies.policy_record_name`.

policy_source.description: Set this value to `file` to look in the file system for a definition file. Set to `service` to use the Dashboard service.

interval.description: Interval configures the interval in seconds between each retry on a resource sync error.

retry_attempts.description:
RetryAttempts defines the number of retries that the Gateway
should perform during a resource sync (APIs or policies), defaulting
to zero which means no retries are attempted.

control_api_use_mutual_tls.description: Enable Gateway Control API to use Mutual TLS. Certificates can be set via `security.certificates.control_api` section

pinned_public_keys.description: Specify public keys used for Certificate Pinning on global level.

private_certificate_encoding_secret.description: Set the AES256 secret which is used to encode certificate private keys when they uploaded via certificate storage

api_key.description:
This the API key of a user used to authenticate and authorize the Gateway’s access through MDCB.
The user should be a standard Dashboard user with minimal privileges so as to reduce any risk if the user is compromised.
The suggested security settings are read for Real-time notifications and the remaining options set to deny.

bind_to_slugs.description: For an Self-Managed installation this can be left at `false` (the default setting). For Legacy Cloud Gateways it must be set to ‘true’.

call_timeout.description: Call Timeout allows to specify a time in seconds for the maximum allowed duration of a RPC call.

connection_string.description: Use this setting to add the URL for your MDCB or load balancer host.

disable_keyspace_sync.description: Set this option to `true` if you don’t want to monitor changes in the keys from a primary Gateway.

enable_rpc_cache.description: Set this option to `true` to enable RPC caching for keys.

group_id.description:
This is the `zone` that this instance inhabits, e.g. the cluster/data-center the Gateway lives in.
The group ID must be the same across all the Gateways of a data-center/cluster which are also sharing the same Redis instance.
This ID should also be unique per cluster (otherwise another Gateway cluster can pick up your keyspace events and your cluster will get zero updates).

key_space_sync_interval.description: You can use this to set a period for which the Gateway will check if there are changes in keys that must be synchronized. If this value is not set then it will default to 10 seconds.

ping_timeout.description: The maximum time in seconds that a RPC ping can last.

rpc_cert_cache_expiration.description: RPCCertCacheExpiration defines the expiration time of the rpc cache that stores the certificates, defined in seconds

rpc_global_cache_expiration.description: RPCKeysCacheExpiration defines the expiration time of the rpc cache that stores the keys, defined in seconds

rpc_key.description: Your organization ID to connect to the MDCB installation.

rpc_pool_size.description: The number of RPC connections in the pool. Basically it creates a set of connections that you can re-use as needed. Defaults to 5.

ssl_insecure_skip_verify.description:
Set this option to `true` to allow the certificate validation (certificate chain and hostname) to be skipped.
This can be useful if you use a self-signed certificate.

synchroniser_enabled.description: SynchroniserEnabled enable this config if MDCB has enabled the synchoniser. If disabled then it will ignore signals to synchonise recources

use_rpc.description: Set to `true` to connect a worker Gateway using RPC.

use_ssl.description: Set this option to `true` to use an SSL RPC connection.

addrs.description: If you have multi-node setup, you should use this field instead. For example: ["host1:port1", "host2:port2"].

host.description: The Redis host, by default this is set to `localhost`, but for production this should be set to a cluster.

optimisation_max_active.description: Set the number of maximum connections in the Redis connection pool, which defaults to 500. Set to a higher value if you are expecting more traffic.

optimisation_max_idle.description: Set the number of maximum idle connections in the Redis connection pool, which defaults to 100. Set to a higher value if you are expecting more traffic.

password.description: If your Redis instance has a password set for access, you can set it here.

timeout.description: Set a custom timeout for Redis network operations. Default value 5 seconds.

tls_max_version.description:
Maximum TLS version that is supported.
Options: ["1.0", "1.1", "1.2", "1.3"].
Defaults to "1.3".

tls_min_version.description:
Minimum TLS version that is supported.
Options: ["1.0", "1.1", "1.2", "1.3"].
Defaults to "1.2".

use_ssl.description: Enable SSL/TLS connection between your Tyk Gateway & Redis.

name.description: The name of the tracer to initialize. For instance appdash, to use appdash tracer

options.description: Tracing configuration. Refer to the Tracing Docs for the full list of options.

disable.description: To disable uptime tests on this node, set this value to `true`.

poller_group.description: If you have multiple Gateway clusters connected to the same Redis instance, you need to set a unique poller group for each cluster.

checker_pool_size.description: The goroutine pool size to keep idle for uptime tests. If you have many uptime tests running at a high time period, then increase this value.

enable_uptime_analytics.description: Set this value to `true` to have the node capture and record analytics data regarding the uptime tests.

failure_trigger_sample_size.description: The sample size to trigger a `HostUp` or `HostDown` event. For example, a setting of 3 will require at least three failures to occur before the uptime test is triggered.

time_wait.description: The value in seconds between tests runs. All tests will run simultaneously. This value will set the time between those tests. So a value of 60 will run all uptime tests every 60 seconds.

event_timeout.description: The cool-down for the event so it does not trigger again (in seconds).

header_map.description: Headers to set when firing the webhook.

method.description: The method to use for the webhook.

target_path.description: The target path on which to send the request.

template_path.description: The template to load in order to format the request.
